name: Tawang
description: A serene town known for its largest monastery in India and stunning mountain views.

name: Ziro Valley
description: A picturesque valley known for its lush greenery, unique tribal culture, and serene environment.

name: Sela Pass
description: A high-altitude mountain pass that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding Himalayan landscape.

name: Namdapha National Park
description: A vast national park known for its incredible biodiversity and pristine rainforest environment.

name: Itanagar
description: The capital city of Arunachal Pradesh, offering a mix of culture, history, and natural beauty.

name: Bomdila
description: A quaint town known for its monasteries, scenic views, and serene ambiance.

name: Dirang
description: A peaceful village known for its natural beauty, hot springs, and unique tribal culture.

name: Kaziranga National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its population of one-horned rhinoceroses.

name: Majuli
description: The world's largest river island, known for its monasteries and natural beauty.

name: Manas National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and a biosphere reserve known for its diverse wildlife.

name: Sivasagar
description: Known for its historical monuments from the Ahom dynasty.

name: Guwahati
description: The largest city in Assam, known for its temples and the mighty Brahmaputra River.

name: Kamakhya Temple
description: One of the most important Shakti Peethas, located atop Nilachal Hill.

name: Dibrugarh
description: Known as the Tea City of India, Dibrugarh offers scenic landscapes and a vibrant culture.

name: Bodh Gaya
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Bodh Gaya is where Lord Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree.

name: Nalanda
description: An ancient seat of learning, Nalanda is a UNESCO World Heritage Site with ruins of a historic university.

name: Rajgir
description: An ancient city with connections to Buddhism and Jainism, known for its hot springs and scenic beauty.

name: Vaishali
description: An ancient city significant to both Buddhism and Jainism, Vaishali is known for its archaeological and historical importance.

name: Patna
description: The capital city of Bihar, Patna is a vibrant mix of history, culture, and modernity.

name: Vikramshila
description: An ancient center of learning, known for its contribution to Buddhist education and culture.

name: Barabar Caves
description: The oldest surviving rock-cut caves in India, dating back to the Mauryan Empire.

name: Chitrakote Falls
description: Known as the 'Niagara Falls of India,' Chitrakote Falls is a stunning natural attraction on the Indravati River.

name: Kanger Valley National Park
description: A biodiversity hotspot, Kanger Valley National Park is known for its unique limestone caves and rich wildlife.

name: Barnawapara Sanctuary
description: A small yet beautiful sanctuary, Barnawapara is home to rich flora and fauna, including leopards, bisons, and peacocks.

name: Raipur
description: The capital city of Chhattisgarh, Raipur is a hub of culture, commerce, and historical sites.

name: Bhoramdeo Temple
description: Known as the 'Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh,' this 11th-century temple is famous for its exquisite carvings.

name: Sirpur
description: An archaeological site with a mix of Hindu and Buddhist heritage, Sirpur is a treasure trove of history.

name: Danteshwari Temple
description: A revered temple dedicated to Goddess Danteshwari, considered one of the 52 Shakti Peethas.

name: Calangute Beach
description: Known as the 'Queen of Beaches,' Calangute is one of Goa's most popular beach destinations.

name: Dudhsagar Falls
description: A four-tiered waterfall, Dudhsagar Falls is a mesmerizing natural wonder situated on the Mandovi River.

name: Panaji
highlights: Church of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception
description: The capital of Goa, Panaji is known for its Portuguese-style architecture, vibrant streets, and serene riverside promenades.

name: Baga Beach
description: One of the most happening beaches in Goa, Baga Beach is famous for its nightlife, water sports, and beach shacks.

name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
description: A historic church in Old Goa, the Basilica of Bom Jesus is a significant landmark known for its baroque architecture.

name: Aguada Fort
highlights: Scenic Views of the Arabian Sea
description: A historic Portuguese fort, Aguada Fort is a well-preserved landmark offering stunning views of the Arabian Sea.

name: Anjuna Beach
description: Known for its serene vibes and vibrant flea market, Anjuna Beach is a favorite among tourists seeking a laid-back atmosphere.

name: Statue of Unity
description: A monumental statue of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel, the Statue of Unity is a marvel of modern engineering.

name: Gir National Park
description: The only home of the Asiatic lions, Gir National Park is a sanctuary teeming with wildlife and natural beauty.

name: Rann of Kutch
description: A surreal white desert, the Rann of Kutch is a must-visit destination known for its unique landscape and vibrant festival.

name: Somnath
description: A historic pilgrimage site, Somnath is famous for its revered temple and coastal charm.

name: Dwarka
description: An ancient city, Dwarka is one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites and holds immense religious significance.

name: Sabarmati Ashram
description: A place of historic importance, Sabarmati Ashram was the residence of Mahatma Gandhi and a center for the freedom movement.
nearest_airport: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport, Ahmedabad

name: Saputara
description: Gujarat's only hill station, Saputara offers a serene environment, picturesque landscapes, and a cool climate.

name: Kurukshetra
description: Known as the land of the Mahabharata, Kurukshetra is a historic city with immense spiritual significance.

name: Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary
description: A haven for bird watchers, Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is home to numerous migratory and resident bird species.

name: Pinjore Gardens
description: A beautiful example of Mughal gardens, Pinjore Gardens is a tranquil retreat with fountains and lush greenery.

name: Morni Hills
description: The only hill station in Haryana, Morni Hills offers serene landscapes, perfect for a peaceful getaway.

name: Brahma Sarovar
description: A revered water body, Brahma Sarovar is considered one of the largest and holiest tanks in India.

name: Surajkund
description: Famous for its annual crafts mela, Surajkund is a vibrant hub of art, culture, and traditional crafts.

name: Kalesar National Park
description: A dense forest area, Kalesar National Park is a great destination for nature and wildlife enthusiasts.

name: Dharamshala
best_month: March to June, September to November
description: Known as the residence of the Dalai Lama, Dharamshala offers a blend of spirituality and natural beauty.

name: Kullu
best_month: March to June, September to November
description: Known as the 'Valley of Gods', Kullu is a picturesque valley surrounded by towering hills and deodar forests.

name: Dalhousie
best_month: March to June, October to November
description: Dalhousie is a charming hill station with colonial charm, lush greenery, and serene landscapes.

name: Spiti Valley
description: Known as the 'Middle Land', Spiti Valley is a cold desert with breathtaking landscapes and monasteries.

name: Chamba
best_month: March to June, September to November
description: A historic town, Chamba is known for its ancient temples, art, and stunning views of the Himalayas.

name: Shimla
best_month: March to June, December to February (for snow)
description: The capital of Himachal Pradesh, Shimla is known for its colonial architecture, scenic hills, and pleasant weather.

name: Manali
description: A popular hill station, Manali is famous for its adventure activities and picturesque landscapes.

name: Aizawl
description: Aizawl, the capital city of Mizoram, is known for its scenic beauty, cultural heritage, and vibrant local markets.

name: Dampa Tiger Reserve
description: Dampa Tiger Reserve is a prominent wildlife sanctuary in Mizoram, home to diverse flora and fauna, including tigers and rare bird species.

name: Champhai
description: Champhai, often referred to as the 'Rice Bowl of Mizoram,' offers breathtaking views of lush rice terraces and vibrant culture.

name: Lunglei
description: Lunglei is known for its serene environment and natural beauty, making it a perfect destination for peace seekers and nature lovers.

name: Reiek
description: Reiek is a picturesque hill station offering a perfect blend of adventure and cultural experiences, along with panoramic views.

name: Vantawng Falls
description: Vantawng Falls, the highest waterfall in Mizoram, is a spectacular natural attraction surrounded by dense forests and greenery.

name: Hmuifang
description: Hmuifang is a pristine destination with untouched forests, offering a perfect getaway for adventure and nature enthusiasts.

name: Chennai
description: Chennai, the capital city of Tamil Nadu, is a bustling metropolis known for its beaches, temples, and cultural heritage.

name: Mahabalipuram
description: Mahabalipuram, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is famous for its rock-cut temples and sculptures along the Bay of Bengal.

name: Kanyakumari
description: Kanyakumari, the southernmost tip of India, is known for its confluence of three seas and breathtaking views of sunrise and sunset.

name: Madurai
description: Madurai, known as the 'Temple City,' is home to the iconic Meenakshi Amman Temple and boasts a rich cultural heritage.

name: Rameswaram
description: Rameswaram is a sacred pilgrimage site and part of the Char Dham Yatra, known for its temples and serene beaches.

name: Ooty
best_month: March to June, September to November
description: Ooty, often referred to as the 'Queen of Hill Stations,' is a popular destination for its lush greenery, pleasant climate, and colonial charm.

name: Coimbatore
description: Coimbatore, also known as the 'Manchester of South India,' is a major hub for textiles and spirituality, surrounded by scenic landscapes.

name: Cherrapunji
description: Cherrapunji, known as one of the wettest places on Earth, is famous for its waterfalls, caves, and lush greenery.

name: Shillong
description: Shillong, the capital of Meghalaya, is known for its picturesque landscapes, vibrant culture, and pleasant weather.

name: Mawlynnong
description: Mawlynnong is renowned as the cleanest village in Asia, offering stunning landscapes and a glimpse into traditional Khasi culture.

name: Living Root Bridges
description: The living root bridges of Meghalaya, crafted from intertwined roots of rubber trees, are a remarkable example of bio-engineering.

name: Nongriat
description: Nongriat is famous for its double-decker living root bridge and its breathtaking natural surroundings.

name: Umiam Lake
description: Umiam Lake, also known as Barapani, is a popular spot for relaxation and water sports, surrounded by scenic hills.

name: Dawki
description: Dawki is a picturesque town known for the Umngot River, famous for its crystal-clear waters and serene environment.

name: Loktak Lake
description: Loktak Lake is the largest freshwater lake in northeastern India, famous for its phumdis and vibrant ecosystem.

name: Imphal
description: Imphal, the capital city of Manipur, is known for its cultural heritage, vibrant markets, and historical sites.

name: Kangla Fort
description: Kangla Fort is a historical site in Imphal, reflecting the rich cultural and historical legacy of Manipur.

name: Keibul Lamjao National Park
description: Keibul Lamjao National Park is the world's only floating park, home to the endangered Sangai deer and unique ecosystems.

name: Ukhrul
description: Ukhrul is a serene hill station known for its scenic beauty, unique flora, and vibrant Tangkhul culture.

name: Andro Village
description: Andro Village is a cultural hub showcasing traditional pottery and the unique heritage of Manipur.

name: Thoubal
description: Thoubal is a peaceful town in Manipur, known for its natural beauty, local markets, and community lifestyle.

name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves
description: Ajanta and Ellora Caves are UNESCO World Heritage Sites showcasing ancient rock-cut architecture and stunning sculptures.

name: Mumbai
description: Mumbai, the financial capital of India, is known for its bustling streets, iconic landmarks, and vibrant culture.

name: Shirdi
description: Shirdi is a famous pilgrimage site and the birthplace of Sai Baba, attracting millions of devotees every year.

name: Lonavala
description: Lonavala is a scenic hill station known for its misty weather, green landscapes, and waterfalls.

name: Mahabaleshwar
description: Mahabaleshwar is a popular hill station known for its breathtaking views, cool climate, and strawberry farms.

name: Pune
description: Pune, known as the 'Oxford of the East,' is a city rich in cultural and historical significance.

name: Alibaug
description: Alibaug is a coastal town known for its pristine beaches, historic forts, and peaceful ambiance.
nearest_airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport, Mumbai

name: Khajuraho
description: Khajuraho is famous for its stunning temples, known for their intricate carvings and sculptures depicting various aspects of life.

name: Kanha National Park
description: Kanha National Park is one of the largest and most well-maintained parks in India, known for its lush meadows and tiger reserve.

name: Ujjain
description: Ujjain is one of the holiest cities in India, famous for the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple and the Kumbh Mela.
nearest_airport: Devi Ahilya Bai Holkar Airport, Indore

name: Bandhavgarh National Park
description: Bandhavgarh National Park is a popular tiger reserve, offering excellent wildlife sightings and a rich ecosystem.

name: Pachmarhi
description: Pachmarhi, also known as the 'Queen of Satpura,' is a hill station with stunning waterfalls and lush greenery.

name: Bhopal
description: Bhopal, the capital city of Madhya Pradesh, is known for its beautiful lakes and rich cultural heritage.

name: Sanchi
description: Sanchi is famous for its Buddhist monuments and the Great Stupa, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Munnar
description: Munnar is a beautiful hill station in Kerala, famous for its tea gardens, misty landscapes, and cool weather.

name: Alleppey
description: Alleppey, known as the 'Venice of the East,' is famous for its serene backwaters and houseboat experiences.

name: Kochi
description: Kochi, also known as Cochin, is a vibrant port city known for its cultural diversity and historical significance.

name: Wayanad
description: Wayanad is a lush green district in Kerala known for its serene environment, wildlife, and adventure opportunities.

name: Kovalam
description: Kovalam is a famous beach destination in Kerala, known for its golden sands, palm-lined shores, and Ayurvedic wellness centers.

name: Thekkady
description: Thekkady is a haven for wildlife enthusiasts, known for the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary and serene lake.

name: Varkala
description: Varkala is a quaint coastal town famous for its cliffside views, pristine beaches, and spiritual significance.

name: Hampi
description: Hampi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, known for its ancient ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire and breathtaking temples.

name: Mysore Palace
description: Mysore Palace is a royal residence in Mysuru, known for its grandeur and intricate architecture.

name: Jog Falls
description: Jog Falls is one of the highest waterfalls in India, cascading majestically over the Sharavathi River.

name: Coorg
description: Coorg, also known as Kodagu, is a serene hill station famous for its coffee plantations, lush greenery, and pleasant climate.

name: Badami Caves
description: Badami Caves are famous for their rock-cut temples that showcase exquisite carvings and sculptures from ancient Indian architecture.

name: Gokarna
description: Gokarna is a serene coastal town known for its pristine beaches and spiritual ambiance.

name: Chikmagalur
description: Chikmagalur is a picturesque hill station known for its coffee plantations, trekking trails, and cool climate.

name: Baidhyanath Dham
description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, Baidhyanath Dham is a major Hindu pilgrimage site located in Deoghar.

name: Netarhat
description: Known as the 'Queen of Chotanagpur', Netarhat is a scenic hill station with lush greenery and serene landscapes.

name: Dassam Falls
description: Dassam Falls is a magnificent waterfall on the Kanchi River, located near Ranchi, offering a picturesque view.

name: Betla National Park
description: Betla National Park is a wildlife sanctuary in the Palamu district, home to elephants, tigers, and other species.

name: Hazaribagh
description: Hazaribagh is known for its natural beauty, wildlife sanctuary, and serene hills.

name: Jonha Falls
description: Jonha Falls, also known as Gautamdhara, is a scenic waterfall surrounded by dense forest near Ranchi.

name: Ranchi
description: Ranchi, the capital of Jharkhand, is a vibrant city known for its waterfalls, hills, and cultural sites.

best_month: March to June, September to November
description: Known as the residence of the Dalai Lama, Dharamshala offers a blend of spirituality and natural beauty.

description: Known as the 'Valley of Gods', Kullu is a picturesque valley surrounded by towering hills and deodar forests.

name: Dalhousie
best_month: March to June, October to November
description: Dalhousie is a charming hill station with colonial charm, lush greenery, and serene landscapes.

description: Known as the 'Middle Land', Spiti Valley is a cold desert with breathtaking landscapes and monasteries.
